intro: Elsholtzia concinna, commonly known as narrowleaf elsholtzia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves and clusters of small, pale blue to purple flowers. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Elsholtzia concinna is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
